params.text: Set of principles or rules of conduct that guide individuals and societies in distinguishing between right and wrong behaviours. It involves the evaluation of actions, decisions, and intentions based on ethical standards and values.

The branch of philosophy that deals with what is morally right or wrong, good or bad, and how individuals and societies should behave. It involves the study of moral principles and values that guide human behavior and decision-making
A system of rules, regulations, and principles established and enforced by a governing authority (such as a government or legal system) to regulate behavior within a society.
